issue.title: [Python] Use a python_version marker instead of a condition
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2464](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2464). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
When installing pyarrow 0.9.0 pipenv complains that futures has no matching versions.

While that may be a bug in pipenv it does not matter. The standard way to specify a conditional dependency is using a marker.

We should use the python_version marker to tell pip if it should install futures or not.
